nodes.bodyText:
Hey @inodeman, I notice that here we are creating a new instance of arraylist to match the method signature. Maybe it would be better to pass null and check internally or perhaps overload the method. Just thinking.
WDYT?
Hi @handreyrc sure, I am adding additional tests, will make the change
why do we need this doneLoading flag, and also the timer? Looks tricky...

Hi @romartin it is because of the service, since we are also calling a server service to get all the Data Types when in BC it might take a bit to complete, so I just set a timer to wait until it finishes.

I still don't see the need for a timer + flag to achieve this, looks not robust. Actually browsers and js engines provide different solutions for doing/managing sync/async remote calls, in a safe way, rather than assuming by ourselves the state for the call...
Again, I don't have all the context here, so maybe I'm wrong, but what about considering "encapsulating" the call in a javascript Promise?  This way, browser will manage the lifecycle for you and you can also check the promise status, and react when necessary, even when errors, in a proper and safe way. Also, depending on how you use the promise instance, notice by defintiion a Promise is only being called once. So if it applies, you can also improve the performance of the calls to this because it'll be done once, and browser ensures that, also ensures you'll get the then/catch also being called properly. No need for any timer, no need for a flag, just need for the use of Promises properly, and let browser do this job.
WDYT?
Sorry for being a bit rude on this, but I think it's not completely safe to rely on this kind of solutions, although I'm open for dicussions, I know world is not ideal :)
Thanks anyway @inodeman , good job overall!! 👍
hey @inodeman , I still see the use of the gwt timer here. Could you please consider my comment above? Lemme know what you think
ok I see it's replaced by an scheduler, good enought! 👍 thx
maybe this can be simplified using Streams in a single or couple of lines
Hi @romartin I got this code from another file. See here, let me know if I should convert to Streams

well it's just a minor thing, it's more about the language declaration and styling than the results, once I see an iteration with some condition/s inside the loop, I just feel that it can could maybe be repsented using "functional" style rather than the "old" way, as it usually results on some more clear and easier code to read and understand.
Anyway, it's just a really minor thing, nothing that could prevent this from being merged IMO.
let's throw some exception when we encounter this and let's  log the type that wasn't processed by these if-else branches.
Hi @domhanak will throw Illegal Argument Exception

Hi @domhanak this caused the issue that it could not open the diagram you mentioned, if execution reaches this else, it simply means that it does not contain a data type, so removing the throwing exception.
Javadoc
Hi @domhanak JavaDoc added
I suggest to split this into smaler test cases. For each datatype we should have one test case.
Hi @domhanak refactored and split now
Could we please also test type that look like this com.myspace.Person or org.native.common.logging.ParserWagon Just to be sure.
Hi @domhanak added object "com.myspace.Person"
I notice we only check last item, would it be possible to check cases where we find more dataTypes in one definition?
Also, what if we extract same datatype form one definition? Can that happen? is the expected output one datatype or two datatypes?
Hi @domhanak added additional tests, now testing 2 each time
Why is this removed?
@domhanak my mistake, readded

please split this into multiple test cases,

Empty  diagram
Test with two nodes

I would also add check that verify that parent class AbstractDataTypeCache contains expected datatypes when the diagram is empty or has nodes with dataIOSets.
Hi @domhanak split into two now
todo
Hi @domhanak not needed for now, removed

nodes.bodyText: it can be static
Hi @romartin changed now
no need for this empty else block, isn't it?
Hi @romartin removed

why the cache relies on the BpmnNode instance? This is an eclipse model object, not our internal model object. I would prefer, if possible, to always rely on our models, so we can populate the cache any time, whitout the need for having the eclipse models being parsed as well.
WDYT?

Hi @romarting, if you could explain more, as far as I can see it is from our models. See
 let me know
oh sorry, you're right!! I just got confused on the package for the class.... yeah everyting ok! sorry!
another gwt timer here?

Hi @romartin on the first timer, I use it to give enough time for the DataNameService to return the DataTypes, let me know what else can I use. On second instance if I do not set the timer, when it looses focus it does not get set right, let me know

Can we also add test for adding data types from Process Variable dropdown, Global Variables dropdown, Task Data I/O dropdown? Or did I miss it?
Also the values you use here, I suggest changing them to something actually used - com.myspace.DataTypeOfTypes - since Test 1 and Test 2 can never be inputted into BPMN Editor - text box does not allow whitespaces.
Hi @domhanak I added imports since it is basically the same mechanism for all, there is also tests for calling the service. I changed Test 1 and Test 2 now. Let me know

Hi @domhanak basically what it does it goes through all the nodes and checks instances, if it is not from the list it does not do anything, so if it reaches else, it is not really an error, it is just a node that does not contain data types

@inodeman okay, maybe we could log it as info? Could be useful when we add support for more nodes, might help us identifying what is missing.
Anyway I agree it is a detail, I leave it up to you.

@inodeman I think we have missed some nodes here. For example IntermediateLinkEvent
When you open a process with node that is missing in this if-else tree the data type won't be extracted.
Apologies for missing this in earlier review.
Imho the AbstractDataTypeCacheTest needs to be extended for every possible node we have in our BPMN editor that can set Data Types in some way.
Hi @domhanak added IntermediateLinkEvent, also added tests for it

this method does not seem to be covered in tests, same for other methods. See - https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=org.kie.workbench%3Akie-wb-common&pullRequest=3347&metric=new_coverage&view=list
